div.l: Toward þe Fenne both Aleyn̄ and eke Iohn
And when̄ þe myller sigh þey were a gon̄
He half a Busschell of hur flour͗e hath take
And badde his gode wyfe go knede hit in a kake
And seyde y trowe the clerkꝭes wer͗e aferd
Yette kan̄ a myller make a clerkꝭes berde
For alle her arte yet lette hem go her wey
Lo wher͗e he goth ye lette þe children̄ pley
They gete hym nought so lyghtely by my croun̄
These sely clerkꝭes rome up and doun̄
With kepe kepe stand stand Iossa warderere
Go whistel þᵘou and y schall kepe hym ther͗e
But schortely tyll hit was veray nyght
They kowde not though þey dyd all her myght
Hur capull cache he ranne awey so faste
Tyll in a dyche they caught hym at the laste
Wery and wete as beste ys in the Rayn
Cometh sely Iohn and with hym aleyn̄
Allas quoth Iohn þe day that y was borne
Now are we dryven̄ to hethyng and to scorne
Our͗e corne ys stolen̄ men̄ woll us foles calle
Bothe the wardeyn̄ and oure felowꝰes alle
And namely the myller weyleawey
Thus playneth Iohn as he goth by the wey
Toward þe mylle and Bayard in his hond
The myller syttyng by the fyr͗e they fond
For hit was nyght and further myght they nought
But for the loue of god þey hym bysought
Off herborow and ese for hur peny
The myller seyd ageyn̄ and þ̉er be any
Such as hit ys ye schull haue your͗e parte
My house ys streyrte but ye haue lerned arte
Ye kan̄ by argumēnt make a plase
A myle brod of xxᵗⁱ fote of spase
Lete see now yf this plase mow suffyse
Or make hit Romer with speche as ys yoᵘur gyse
